meanings.definition: An object or shape that is longer in one direction than it is wide.
meanings.sent1: The tablet was an oblong, rectangular shape.
meanings.sent2: The painting featured an oblong frame on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The oblong cookie jar on the shelf looked like a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: The oblong shadow of the tree stretched across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The oblong pool reflected the sunset beautifully.

meanings.definition: Having an elongated shape, typically longer than it is wide.
meanings.sent1: She carried an oblong box under her arm.
meanings.sent2: The oblong table fit perfectly in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The oblong balloon floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His oblong face made him easily recognizable in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The oblong shadows of the buildings stretched across the street.
